intro: Corydalis heterocarpa var. koidzumiana, commonly known as the Koidzumi corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The flowers typically have two upper petals that are spurred, a distinctive feature of the genus Corydalis. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained, moist soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated in horticulture for its early spring blooming habit.
